translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sakka’s Questions
The Story of the Elder Soṇakaṅkaṇa
“With faith I went forth
and went forth from the household life into homelessness;
I wore garments of bark,
and I was intent on the practice of austerities.
The Fortunate One, the one who sees what is good,
the chief in the world, the bull of a man,
appeared at that time,

analyzed: tārayantaḥ mahā jana  balañca vata me khīṇa
translated: delivering the great people.🔽But my strength was exhausted,
and I was afflicted with a great illness;
remembering the best of the Buddhas,
I made a supreme memorial on the bank.
With a delighted mind,
I scattered it with my own hands;
golden flowers,
with a joyful mind.
As if in the presence of the Sambuddha,
I served the memorial;
by that act of worship,🔽of the one who sees what is good, the one who is restrained,
having gone to the world of the gods,
I obtained great happiness;
there I was golden-hued,
the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Eighty koṭis of women
adorned with ornaments,
always attended on me,
the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Sixty-eight thousand drums,

original: bheriyo paṇavāni ca;🔽Saṅkhā ca ḍiṇḍimā tattha,
analyzed: bheriyaḥ paṇavāni ca  saṅkhā ca ḍiṇḍimā tattha
translated: and also paṇava drums,🔽conches and ḍiṇḍima drums,
the sound of the war drums resounded.
Eighty-four thousand elephants,
adorned,
with three-part tusks,
elephants with sixty years of age.
Covered with nets of gold,
they served me.
In the army, in the elephants,
I had no lack.
Of golden flowers with stamens,🔽I experienced the result.

analyzed: aṭṭhapaññāsakkhattum ca  deva rajjam akārayi  ekasattatikkhattum ca  cakkavattī ahosaha
translated: Fifty-eight times I was a king of the gods,🔽Seventy-one times a wheel-turning monarch,
a hundred times a king of the earth,
I ruled over the great earth.
Now I have attained the deathless,
the unconditioned, so hard to see.
The fetters are completely destroyed,
there is no more renewed existence.

analyzed: aṭṭhārase kappa sate  yam puppham abhiropayi
translated: Eighteen hundred eons ago,🔽I offered a flower.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,🔽…
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.
The four analytical knowledges,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sovaṇṇakiṅkaṇiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā sovaṇṇakiṅkaṇiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Sovaṇṇakiṅkaṇiya recited these verses.
The Story of Elder Sovaṇṇakiṅkaṇiya is the ninth.
